page.title: 07Polhill Riding Centre
page.content: A group of us went to{Polhill Riding {Centre.}The{owner is blind}but she is able to run the centre. She set it up because she likes horses and wants {handicapped people}to be able to ride. The centre is for the{mentally and {physically handicapped.}Some people who are not handicapped come and ride because it is more fun for the horses.There are{eight horses}and pupils are taught in a ring with the instructress in the middle. The owner takes pupils out on hacks helped by sighted riders. The owner hopes to have a ramp so that people in wheelchairs can mount easily. She also wants handrails leading to the paddock and fields. At the Centre Summer Show a girl without arms put the saddle on her pony and walked, trotted, cantered and jumped.
